3.18.21  10:04 am   I've been meaning to ask this for nearly 2 years now, since I first heard "Might Quit." In the line "I'll never say goodbye- yes I will, but I won't tonight." Was the "yes I will" an immediate afterthought of writing "I'll never say goodbye?"

     It's one of my favourite lines from your songs, for some reason it really resonates with me. Keep up the awesome work, by the way!

3.18.21  9:42 am   is your next song going to be motivational?

3.17.21  11:37 pm   There is something pretty weird about your music that I am rather curious about, your uniqueness, all of your songs are really unique in style, and it's a pattern that I've seen in a lot of self taught musicians, but I cant figure out why. Do you have any tips,or maybe a posible explanation on why your music is so different.

     Also, why the font in the question text input is mono spaced? Why not the same as the answer?
3.17.21  10:49 pm   ever thought of making different genres of music?

3.17.21  8:52 pm   After listening many many times I've started noticing that the part that enjoy and makes me smile the most in "Here comes the Sun" is the part after "I can't explain the way I'm feeling" where you start mumbling the melody, and I was quite surprised by that fact because as a songwriter I always thought writing something meaningful brought out more emotions into a song.

     Do you think sometimes saying nothing can bring more emotions then actually saying something, do you think it can make the qualities of a song shine more and did you intend for that part to make someone feel that way or was it just a coincidence.

3.17.21  8:10 pm   what kind of music would you sort your music to?

3.17.21  2:03 am   not gonna lie i'm been smoking weed and drinking and i just came but i was rewatching for the 27th time or whatever here comes the sun and i really took it in as a deeper musicial/visual/linguistic unified experience in some ways i feel like i hadn't before. that's some good shit, man. the work you create and your dedication to your craft is simultaneously inspiring and terrifying to me in the just about the best way possible i think.

3.17.21  12:34 am   there's a song that i started writing when i was 15 years old, and now that i'm a fair bit older i've been interested in going back to finish it. problem is, the lyrics in and the central ideas in that song are very much from the perspective of a 15 year old. i'm not sure how to write any more of it and have it feel genuine, much less how i would even go about giving a genuine sounding delivery if i ever record it. have you ever experienced something like this? what should i do? i refuse to believe that i'm now incapable of developing the idea just because i'm older.

3.17.21  12:29 am   I made my friend a video for their birthday, they thought it was funny. I did this again for a different friend's birthday and they also said they thought it was very funny. I very much want to make more funny videos for my friends and maybe the world but I have absolutely no ideas on how to make a non-birthday oriented video. With no urgency or restrictions I am having a difficult time mustering and semblance of creativity. As someone who seems to be profoundly creative, do you have any tips as to how I might be able to come up with ideas for videos to make?
